metadata.title: CVE-2009-0147 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 andearlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, and other products allow remote attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1)JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg, and (3)JBIG2Stream::readGenericBitmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-0147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler52 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

cups - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-bsd - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-client - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-common - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-core-drivers - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-daemon - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-ipp-utils - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-ppdc - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
cups-server-common - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
libcups2 - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
libcupscgi1 - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
libcupsimage2 - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
libcupsmime1 - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
libcupsppdc1 - 1.4.1-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
cups package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1-5ubuntu2').
